thread.title: U.S. regulator wins order halting coin offering scheme

title: U.S. regulator wins order halting coin offering scheme
text:
May 29, 2018 / 8:50 PM / Updated 21 minutes ago U.S. regulator wins order halting coin offering scheme Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said on Tuesday it had won an emergency court order halting an alleged fraud involving an initial coin offering that raised as much as $21 million from investors in the United States and elsewhere. FILE PHOTO: The headquarters of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) are seen in Washington, July 6, 2009. REUTERS/Jim Bourg
The court also approved an emergency asset freeze and the appointment of a receiver for Titanium Blockchain Infrastructure Services Inc, the firm behind the alleged scheme, the SEC said in a statement. Editing by Eric Walsh; Editing by Mohammad Zargham
